text: the turning point for me
occurred four or five months after I
graduated so I got a call from a
professor that I'd had in the second
year at the Harvard Business School and
he said if you were to go raise some
money from some investors around town to
support your family and your travel
expenses for you to conduct a thoughtful
two-year search for a company to buy I
think those investors would would
provide all the equity necessary to buy
that company and put you in the position
of going off and running it for the
investors I said really and I thought
about that for maybe three days and I
found three or four investors to back me
in my search and I was off to the races
Pacific Lake is a special-purpose
private equity fund that solely invests
in recent graduates of top MBA programs
who know one thing and that is that they
want to be in business for themselves
and run their own company we provide
them with enough money to support their
family and travel expenses to conduct a
two-year thorough search in the
continental USA and in exchange for that
we get the right to provide all of the
equity necessary to buy the company that
they might find as a result of that
search process I think some students
might find my experience buying and
running small companies to be helpful to
them
in the process of figuring out what they
want to do post graduation I think when
a recent graduate of a top MBA program
thinks about the possibility of running
a small company not having had any
experience doing that I think it's a
daunting task it seems like a daunting
task to him or her I was fortunate
enough to have some strong directors on
my board who had run companies and I
basically identified the problems picked
up the phone and called them and said
what do I do about this and more often
than not they gave me the good advice
the correct advice
and more often than not I was able to
execute on it and so we had a good
outcome
